result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to 15CF704 per Judge
Per Judge - apply $100 cash bond from 15CM832 to 15CF704

Minutes:  15CF704/15CM832.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hans Koesser.  Cases are resolved.  

15CF704 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 10/29/15 @ 1:30pm.  Remaining count is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

15CM832 - dismissed & read-in on State's motion per plea agreement with 15CF704.  Bond to be held pending disposition of 15CF704.

Minutes:  15CF704/15CM832.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Watson.  Atty Watson moves to w/draw as counsel due to conflict in their office.  Motion is granted by the court.  Atty Watson reports that Atty Koesser has been appointed.  Clerk Lehman will contact Atty Koesser to schedule a FPT date.  JS to remain on for 10/12/15 @ 9am.
